text.content:
Many of the species of 5e Dungeons and Dragons are present in Materia but with certain changes to reflect the world they originate from. You will also find some new species that as of yet are to be published by Dungeons and Dragons, LLC.

With the release of Monsters of the Multiverse and the changes brought to more than 30 of the player species most of these will be applied to Materia however somethings will change.

Universal Rules

Ability Tied Features. Any feature that used to be tied to Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma now allows you to choose which score to use when you select the species.

Alignments. They still exist but are completely up to the player.

Custom Lineage. Is not available in Materia.

Long Rest Feature. There are no longer any species features recovered through Short Rests.

Movement Speed. All species have a base walking speed of 30 feet or more.

Nature Weapons. Any species that provided nature weapons, such as claws, bites, etc; now allows you to choose either Strength or Dexterity to be used when you select the species.

Proficiency Swapping. As per Tasha's Cauldron of Everything

Proficiency Replacement
ProficiencyReplacement Proficiency
SkillSkill
ArmorSimple/martial weapon or tool
Simple WeaponSimple weapon or tool
Martial WeaponSimple/martial weapon or tool or language
ToolTool or simple weapon or language

Species Magics. Any spells gained through the species now can be cast with your own spell slots in addition to the per long rest specifications.

Stat Bonus. All species have the choice of a +2 to one ability score and +1 to a different ability score, or three +1 to three different ability scores.

Subraces. Are removed and all are their own free standing species.

Sunlight Sensitivity. This feature is removed from all species that previously had it.

Creature Type

Every creature in D&D, including each player character, has a special tag in the rules that identifies the type of creature they are. Most player characters are of the Humanoid type. A species tells you what your character's creature type is.

Here is a list of the game's creature types in alphabetical order: Aberration, Beast, Celestial, Construct, Dragon, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, Giant, Humanoid, Monstrosity, Ooze, Plant, Undead. These types do not have rules themselves, but some rules in the game affect creatures of certain types in different ways. For example, the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplDominatePe]{Dominate Person} spell doesn't work on non-Humanoids.

Life Span

The typical life span of a player character in the D&D multiverse is about a century, assuming the character does not meet a violent end on an adventure. Members of some species, such as dwarves, elves and tortles, can live for centuries. If typical members of a species can live longer than a century, that fact is mentioned in the species's description.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.hSVQIK6j4uJ6RzGX]{Aarakocra}

They are the eagle like Featherfolk.

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. Your size is Medium. Aarakocra are about 5 feet tall. They have thin, lightweight bodies that weigh between 80 and 100 pounds.

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Flight. You have a flying speed to your walking speed. To use this speed, you cannot be wearing medium or heavy armor. The wingspan of a mature aarakocra is typically 15 feet.

Talons. Your talons are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier (You choose this when you select this species), instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

Unflappable. You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end being grappled and the weakened condition on yourself.

Wind Caller. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplGustOfWind]{Gust of Wind} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast the spell using any level 2+ spell slots you have.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it when you cast Gust of Wind with this trait (choose when you select this species).

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.Nmirx1iajHEIuxOT]{Aasimar}

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium or Small. You choose your size when you select this species.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Celesital Resistance. You have Resistance to Necrotic damage and Radiant damage.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Healing Hands. As a Magic action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your Proficiency Bonus. The creature regains a number of Hit Points equal to the total rolled. Once you use this trait, you cannot use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

Light Bearer. You know the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplLight00000]{Light} cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this species).

Celestial Revelation. When you reach character level 3, choose one of the revelation options below. Thereafter, you can use a Bonus Action to unleash the celestial energy within yourself, gaining the benefits of that revelation. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a Bonus Action. You can use this trait a number of times equal to half your Proficiency Bonus (rounded up), regaining all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest:

Necrotic Shroud. Your eyes briefly become pools of darkness, and ghostly, flightless wings sprout from your back temporarily. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Intelligence or Wisdom or Charisma modifier; choosen when you select this species) or become &Reference[Frightened] of you until the end of your next turn. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra Necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it. The extra damage equals your Proficiency Bonus.

Radiant Consumption. Searing light temporarily radiates from your eyes and mouth. For the duration, you shed Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature other than you within 10 feet of you takes Radiant damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra Radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it. The extra damage equals your Proficiency Bonus.

Radiant Soul. Two luminous, spectral wings sprout from your back temporarily. Until the transformation ends, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra Radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it. The extra damage equals your Proficiency Bonus.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.kFXcU31youJeAOuT]{Aelf}

Age. Aelfs mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live much longer than humans, however, often exceeding 200 years.

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an Elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an Elf.

Size. Your size is Medium. Aelfs are about the same size as humans, ranging from 5 to 6 feet tall.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Fey Ancestry. You have Advantage on saving throws against being Charmed, and magic cannot put you to sleep.

Skill Versatility. You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

Skillful Intuition. You have a number of d4 equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

When you make an ability check that you are proficient in you can expend any number of these d4s to increase the result. You can wait until after you roll the ability check before deciding to use the these die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails.

You regain any expended die when you finish a Long Rest.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.1RV3DQcwUCyM7gqr]{Air Genasi}

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this species.

Speed. Your Speed is 35 feet.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Lightning Resistance. You have Resistance to Lightning damage.

Mingle with the Wind. You know the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplShockingGr]{Shocking Grasp} cantrip. You can cast it as normal, and you can also cast it as a Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

When you reach character level 3, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplFeatherFal]{Feather Fall} spell with this trait. When you reach character level 5, you can also cast the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplLevitate00]{Levitate} spell with this trait. Once you cast Feather Fall or Levitate with this trait, you cannot cast that spell with it again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this species). None of these spells require spell components when you cast them with this trait.

Unending Breath. You can hold your breath indefinitely while you are not &Reference[Incapacitated].

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.kv4QnpwsFacGzoZD]{Beasthide Shifter}

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision to a range of 60 feet.

Beasthide Shifting. As a Bonus Action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a Bonus Action. When you shift, you gain the following benefits:

  • Temporary Hit Points equal to 2 times your Proficiency Bonus.
  • You can roll 1 Hit Die and gain additional Temporary Hit Points equal to the result. While shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

You can shift a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

When you reach character level 5, if you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright while shifted, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. Your transformation immediately ends as a result. Once you use this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

Bestial Instincts. Channeling the beast within, you have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Acrobatics, Athletics, Intimidation, or Survival.

Feral Impulses. You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the &Reference[Blinded apply=false], &Reference[Deafened apply=false], and &Reference[Weakened apply=false] condition on yourself.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.isn4hhV1ZVMFBnku]{Bighorn Satyr}

Creature Type. You are a Fey.

Size. You are Medium.

Speed. Your Speed is 35 feet.

Battering Ram. You can attack with your Ramming Horns as a Bonus Action. Additionally, your they have the Siege weapon property.

Ramming Horns. Your head and horns are natural weapons, which you can use to make Unarmed Strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier (You choose this when you select this species) Bludgeoning damage, instead of the normal for an Unarmed Strike.

Magic Resistance. You have Advantage on saving throws against spells.

Mirthful Leaps. Whenever you make a long jump or a high jump, you can roll a d8 and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

Sure-footed. You have Advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock you Prone or shove you. Additionally, you can reduces the distance you are moved by up to 10 feet when an effect moves you against your will.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.PWsqn6GaWFB5Kgox]{Bugbear}

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid. You are also considered a goblinoid for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a goblinoid.

Size. Your size is Medium.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision to a range of 60 feet.

Long-Limbed. When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

Powerful Build. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

Sneaky. You are proficient in the Stealth skill. In addition, without squeezing, you can move through and stop in a space large enough for a Small creature.

Stubborn Disposition. You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] or &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition on yourself.

Surprise Attack. If you hit a creature with an attack roll, the creature takes an extra 2d6 damage if it has not taken a turn yet in the current combat.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.0Nsrfr21LWu05xBQ]{Centaur}

Creature Type. You are a Fey.

Size. Your size is Medium. Centaurs stand between 6 and 8 feet tall, with their equine bodies reaching about 4 feet at the withers

Speed. Your Speed is 40 feet.

Bucking Mad. When a creature within range of your hooves makes an attack against a target other than you, you can tale a Reaction to make a hooves attack against the attacking creature. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Charge. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack or Unarmed Strike on the same turn, you can immediately follow that attack with a Bonus A, making one attack against the target with your hooves.

Equine Build. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag; and you increase your walking speed by 10 feet when you take the Dash action.

In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your equine legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet instead of the normal 1 extra foot.

Hooves. Your hooves are natural weapons, which you can use to make Unarmed Strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier (You choose this when you select this species), Bludgeoning damage, instead of the normal for an Unarmed Strike.

Natural Affinity. Your fey connection to nature gives you an intuitive connection to the natural world and the animals within it. You therefore have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Medicine, Nature, or Survival.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.7CGvOXmdDbhBiAGO]{Changeling}

Creature Type. You are a Fey.

Size. You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this species.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Changeling Instincts. Thanks to your connection to the fey realm, you gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion.

Doppelstride. When you are able to move you harness your unique fey nature to leave a convincing but brief illusory image of yourself behind or cause that image to move in your sted. You can utilize this image in two ways:

  • When you move, you leave the illusory image behind. Your movement does not provoke attack of opportunity from creature's that see the image as they do not notice your movements until the end of your turn.

  • When you move, you can have the illusory image move up to twice your Speed before you in a direction of your choosing that you are capable of moving. Your illusory image's movement provokes Opportunity Attacks and has an AC equal to 10 + twice your Proficiency Bonus.

A creature is immune to this effect if it does not rely on sight, as with Blindsight, or can see through illusions, as with Truesight.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Shapechanger. As a Magic action, you can change your appearance and your voice to that of another species. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight and can change your size between Medium and Small. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your game statistics change. You cannot duplicate the appearance of an individual you have never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment are not changed by this trait.

You stay in the new form until you use a Magic action to revert to your true form or until you die.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.PBVTF1rmQKYip9ZY]{Coillinar (Yuan-Ti)}

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this species.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision to a range of 60 feet.

Magic Resistance. You have Advantage on saving throws against spells.

Poison Resilience. You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition on yourself. You also have Resistance to Poison damage.

Serpentine Spellcasting. You know the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplPoisonSpra]{Poison Spray} cantrip. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplAnimalFrie]{Animal Friendship} an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only snakes with it. When you reach character level 3, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplSuggestion]{Suggestion} with this trait. Once you cast Suggestion with this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this species). None of these spells require spell components when you cast them with this trait.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.ONdKuTbTbcZZPkyh]{Deep Gnome}

Age. Gnomes mature at the same rate humans do, and most are expected to settle down into an adult life by around age 40. They can live 350 to almost 500 years.

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an gnome for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an gnome.

Size. Your size is Small. Gnomes are between 3 and 4 feet tall and average about 40 pounds.

Speed. Your base Speed is 30 feet.

Superior Darkvision. You have Darkvision to a range of 120 feet.

Gift of the Svirfneblin. When you reach character level 3, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self} spell with this trait. When you reach character level 5, you can also cast the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplNondetecti]{Nondetection} spell with it. Once you cast Disguise Self or Nondetection with this trait, you cannot cast that spell with it again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this species). None of these spells require spell components when you cast them with this trait.

Gnome Cunning. You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

Svirfneblin Camouflage. When you make a Stealth check, you can make the check with Advantage. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.8Q8FmFqHAOHCCpgs]{Django}

inspired by warcraft trolls that have a symbiotic dependance on the algae and plants the grown in their skin

Age. Django are considered adults after their 13th year. Once they reach maturity it is difficult to identify their age due to their regenerative abilities. Must django live to be 150 years old, but some can be found beyond the age of 500.

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. Your size is Medium. Django are usually a couple of feet taller than humans, lanky, and muscular, but prefer a slouched over posture.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision to a range of 60 feet.


Floracunning. You are proficient in Nature and Survival. When you make any check with these skills, you can roll a d4 and add the number to the ability check.

Regenerator. When you have no more than half of your Hit Points left you can use your Bonus Action to expend a Hit Die to regain health.

You can regain health this way a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Standing Leap. Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

Symbiosis. Your skin and body is able to support basic plant life and more commonly mosses and algae. As a result of this you are able to go 10 times as long without food as you derive nutrition from this source, and you have Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end any affect that only targets humanoids.

Additionally, you also recover from Exhaustion rapidly. Whenever your Exhaustion is reduced, you do so by an additional stage.

Dragonids (Dragonborn)

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. Your size is Medium.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision to a range of 60 feet.

Draconic Ancestry. You have a dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity. Choose one kind of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. This determines the damage type for your other traits, as shown in the table.

Draconic Ancestry
DragonDamage TypeBreath Weapon Shape

Breath Weapon (Recharge 6). When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy. Your Draconic Ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation. When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a Dexterity saving throw or suffer damage, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your choice of Constitution or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this species) + your Proficiency Bonus. A creature takes 1d10 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases at character levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

After you use your breath weapon, roll a d6 at the beginning of each of your turns after using a breath weapon, on a roll of 6, you may use your breath weapon again. Alternatively, you can use your breath weapon again after you complete a Short or Long Rest.

Draconic Resistance. You have Resistance to the damage type associated with your Draconic Ancestry.

Retractable Claws. Your claws are natural weapons, which can be used to make Unarmed Strikes. Extending or retracting If you hit with them, you deal Slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier (You choose this when you select this species), instead of the normal Bludgeoning damage for an Unarmed Strike.

Draconic Manifestation. When you reach character level 5, choose one of the manifestation options below:

1. Ancestral Flight. You can use a Bonus Action to manifest spectral wings on your body. These wings last for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a Flyi Speed equal to your Speed and can hover. You can use this trait a number of times equal to half your Proficiency Bonus (rounded up), regaining all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest

2. Forceful Presence. You can use your understanding of creative diplomacy or intimidation to guide a conversation in your favor. When you make a Charisma check, you can do so with Advantage. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

3. Mighty Exhalations. you gain a second breath weapon. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. The save DC is equal to your Breath Weapon. Whenever you use this trait, choose one:

  • Enervating Breath. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become &Reference[Incapacitated] until the start of your next turn.

  • Repulsion Breath. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 20 feet away from you and be knocked &Reference[Prone].

You can use this trait a number of times equal to half your Proficiency Bonus (rounded up), regaining all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest

4. Vengeful Assault. When you take damage from a creature in range of your a weapon you are wielding or your Unarmed Strike, you can take a Reaction to make an attack with the weapon against that creature. Alternatively, you can use your breath weapon in place of the attack as long as the creature is within the area of effect. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

5. Warding Scales. As a Magic action, you can channel your draconic energy to protect yourself. For 1 minute, you become Immune to the damage type associated with your Draconic Ancestry. Once you use this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.F6hSCabs5pCcjDp2]{Drow Elf}

Age. Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.

Size. Your size is Medium. Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Superior Darkvision. Yoou have Darkvision to a range of 120 feet.

Drow Magic. You know the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights} cantrip. When you reach character level 3, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire} spell with this trait. When you reach character level 5, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplDarkness00]{Darkness} spell with it. Once you cast Faerie Fire or Darkness with this trait, you cannot cast that spell with it again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this species). None of these spells require spell components when you cast them with this trait.

Drow Weapon Training. You have proficiency with rapiers, shortswords, whips and hand crossbows.

Fey Ancestry. You have Advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[Charmed apply=false], and magic cannot put you to sleep.

Keen Senses. You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

Trance. You do not need to sleep, and magic cannot put you to sleep. You can finish a Long Rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you finish this trance, you can gain proficiency in one skill of your choice and with one weapon or tool of your choice, selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next Long Rest.

Dwarven Resilience. You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition on yourself. You also have Resistance to Poison damage.

Eladrin Seasons
d4Season
1Autumn: peace and goodwill, when summer's harvest is shared with all

Age. Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

Fey Step. As a Bonus Action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

When you reach character level 3, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this species):

Autumn. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[Charmed] by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to the creatures.

Winter. When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[Frightened] of you until the end of your next turn.

Spring. When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

Summer. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes Fire damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

Keen Senses. You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

Trance. You do not need to sleep, and magic cannot put you to sleep. You can finish a Long Rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you finish this trance, you can gain proficiency in one skill of your choice and with one weapon or tool of your choice, selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next Long Rest.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.KqML4WI4pyrJYmTj]{Entonmon (Thri-Kreen)}

bug folk, eye brows extend into the antena; last joint/bone of finger is bifercated claw; semi-chitenous skin

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this species.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet, and you have a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.

Darkvision. You have Darkvision to a range of 60 feet.

Adaptive Carapace. While you are not wearing armor, your carapace gives you a base Armor Class of 13 + your Dexterity modifier. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your adaptive carapace.

As a Magic action, you can change the color and, to an extent, the texture of your carapace to match your surroundings, giving you advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in those surroundings.

Broadcasting Antennae. You can communicate your thoughts and emotions telepathically to one willing creature within 120 feet of you. If the creature is not willing then they feel your attempts to convey your thoughts but receive nothing. A creature does not need to share a language with you to understands your thoughts, but must be able to understand at least one language. You can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time. Your telepathic broadcast to a creature is broken if you move more than 120 feet apart, if either of you of is &Reference[Incapacitated], or if either of you mentally break the contact (no action required).

Natural Hopper. Whenever you make a long jump or a high jump, you can increase the number of feet you cover by your Proficiency Bonus, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

Secondary Arms. You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

Moreover, you can utilize your secondary arms in tandem with your primary arms to help your primary arms wield a shield that you do not meet the Strength requirement so your movement is not reduced, or weapons with two hands that do not have the heavy property.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.species.Item.0Iq60V4yoNLQGJ6B]{Ephemeral (Kalashtar)}

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this species.

Speed. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Dual Mind. You have Advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.

Mental Discipline. You have Resistance to Psychic damage, and Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end any condition caused by a source of Psychic damage.

Mind Link. You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within a number of feet of you equal to 10 times your level. You do not need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

When you are using this trait to speak telepathically to a creature, you can use your action to give that creature the ability to speak telepathically with you and share your Dual Mind trait for 1 hour or until you end this effect as an action. To use this ability, the creature must be able to see you and must be within this trait's range. You can give this ability to only one creature at a time; giving it to a creature takes it away from another creature who has it.

Psychic Glamour. Choose one of the following skills: Insight, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion. You have Advantage on all ability checks you make with that skill.

Severed from Dreams. Ephemerals sleep, but they do not connect to the plane of dreams as other creatures do. Instead, their minds draw from the memories of their otherworldly spirit while they sleep. As such, you are Immune to spells and other magical effects that require you to dream, like dream, but not to spells and other magical effects that put you to sleep, like sleep.

While Ephemerals sleep they project an &Reference[Invisible apply=false] avatar that is conscious of themselves that cannot interact directly with creatures or objects, however it can sense the plane of existence their body is on. The avatar has a Flying Speed equal to your Speed and can hover and move through creatures and objects. The avatar cannot move more than 300 feet away from your sleeping body. At any point the avatar can return to the sleeping Ephemeral instantaneously to awaken them.
